Cross-Sector Positioning

CoT sector positioning vs history.

As of 2025-11-25

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Cross-Sector Positioning signal indicates Metals are experiencing broad speculative crowding (44.44%), while Energy shows broad hedger pressure (41.38%).
  • This signal reflects a mixed environment, indicating a transition with distinct positioning extremes in specific sectors.
  • Metals display moderate speculative crowding, and Energy shows moderate hedger pressure versus historical thresholds.

Key Dynamics:

  • Metals' `spec_crowded_long_share` (0.4444 on 2025-11-25) triggers the broad speculative crowding flag.
  • Energy's `hedger_pressure_share` (0.4138 on 2025-11-25) crosses the 0.40 threshold, indicating increased defensive commercial positioning.
  • Unwind risk in FX and Metals has declined since 2025-11-18, moving below the 0.30 threshold by 2025-11-25, reducing immediate squeeze potential.

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal informs market sentiment, risk appetite, and potential for volatility at a sectoral level.
  • It often acts as a mid-cycle indicator, as concentrated positioning typically builds during these phases.
  • Extreme readings can signal potential reversals or exacerbations of trends when combined with liquidity or economic growth indicators.

Data & References:

  • `Cross_Sector_Positioning` (latest observation: 2025-11-25) [Source: Cross_Sector_Positioning.html]
  • The `spec_crowded_long_share` for Metals and `hedger_pressure_share` for Energy most influenced the signal‚Äôs current state.
  • Enriched CoT dataset (`df_cot_signals`), Macro-economic growth indicators (e.g., ISM Manufacturing PMI).

Self-Healing

  • High-Value Inputs to Add:
